sub_topic: Identifying the maximum independent set in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the graph shown below, where the vertices represent cities and the edges represent roads. Determine the maximum number of cities you can visit such that none of the cities are directly connected by a road.

```
A --- B
|\    |
| \   |
|  \  |
|   \ |
C —- D —- E
```

What is the maximum number of cities you can visit such that no two cities are directly connected by a road?
message_2: The maximum number of cities you can visit such that no two cities are directly connected by a road is 3. One possible set of cities to visit is A, C, and E. Another possible set is B and D. In both cases, none of the visited cities are directly connected by a road.
